main event: On May 31, 1956, a student at Queens College in Flushing, Long Island, NY reported a sighting of a white object, half the size of an airline, traveling at great speed. It followed an airline aircraft and eventually passed it with a burst of speed before fading from sight after a 5-10 minute sighting.
interesting points: The object was described as white and about half the size of an airline.
It traveled at great speed and eventually passed an airline aircraft with a burst of speed.
The sighting lasted between 5-10 minutes, allowing for a relatively detailed observation.
The report mentions that a picture was taken of the object with a camera and was intended to be brought to headquarters, indicating a potential visual record of the sighting.
The conclusion of the report suggests that the object could have been a reflecting aircraft, which would account for all the observed details.
sighted object: white object, half the size of an airline, traveling at great speed
location: Queens College, Flushing, Long Island, NY
